Package org.jtrim2.property.swing

package org.jtrim2.property.swing
Contains methods and classes for manipulating and accessing Swing components as JTrim properties.

To convert a Swing property to a JTrim property, you should see the SwingProperties class for various factory methods.

Automatic disabling and enabling of Swing components.

One of the main feature of this package is that you can automatically change the state of a component based on boolean properties (i.e, PropertySource instances having a Boolean value). The state change can be the usual enable/disable component (setEnabled) but this package gives you many more options. For example, you might change the glass pane of a JLayer. For further options see the AutoDisplayState class for factory methods.

For complicated conditions to change state, you might want to use the features provided by BoolProperties.

See Also:
  • AutoDisplayState
  • SwingProperties
  • Related Packages
    Package
    Description
    org.jtrim2.property
    Contains convenience classes for defining properties able to notify clients of changes.
  • Class
    Description
    AutoDisplayState
    Defines static utility methods to allow automatically changing the state of Swing components (e.g.: between enabled and disabled).
    DelayedGlassPane
    Defines the factories for glass panes where one glass pane is to be set immediately and the other is to replace it after the specified timeout, if the glass pane is still needed.
    GlassPaneFactory
    Defines an interface creating JPanel instances as a glass pane for Swing components (those that have glass pane).
    SwingForwarderFactory<ListenerType>
    Creates listeners invoking the run() method of a Runnable.
    SwingProperties
    Contains static factory methods for conversion between Swing properties and properties of JTrim.
    SwingPropertySource<ValueType,ListenerType>
    Defines the value of a usual property in Swing.
